result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles W Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Concurrent with: any other probation sentence

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS AND DNA SURCHARGE.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Case 14CF1284 was dismissed and read into: 14CF538.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles W Smith in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.   Penalty enhancer struck on Ct. 1 by Court upon motion of the State.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 1/2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 2 years Probation  - consecutive to any other sentence but the Probation is concurrent to any other probation sentence.  
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs totaling $268.00 - apply bail. 
- DNA Surcharge totaling $250.00 - apply bail.
- Conditions of Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.  No presence on any premises whose primary buseinss is serving or selling alcohol (i.e> bars, taverns or liquor stores).   DNA Sample if not yet provided. 
- 9 months jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 02/05/2015 by 6:00 p.m.. Non working hours with standard release conditions. 

Expungement addressed.
Defense presents arguments for expungement. 
Court denies expungement.
